commit_list.message:
fix for issue #1896

If the enumerable is an even multiple of the counter (n) and an explicit
pad is given, you get an extra element.

Enum.chunks([1,2,3], 3)
iex> [[1,2,3]]
as expected, but

Enum.chunks([1,2,3], 3, 3, [""])
iex> [[1,2,3],[""]]
as not expected
commit_list.repo_description: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications

commit_list.message:
fix for issue #1896

If the enumerable is an even multiple of the counter (n) and an explicit
pad is given, you get an extra element.

Enum.chunks([1,2,3], 3)
iex> [[1,2,3]]
as expected, but

Enum.chunks([1,2,3], 3, 3, [""])
iex> [[1,2,3],[""]]
as not expected

commit_list.repo_description: Ruby toolkit for the GitHub API

commit_list.message:
remove leading slashes in paths for enterprise use

Main fix is in Request#request -- just strips the leading slash.
I also removed the leading slashes in existing calls.
I had considered doing this in spec/helper.rb, but couldn't get a
good error message.
module Octokit::Request
  alias :request_without_assert :request
  def request(method, path, options, version, authenticate, raw, force_urlencoded)
    path.start_with?('/').should == false #will fail in github:enterprise
    request_without_assert(method, path, options, version, authenticate, raw, force_urlencoded)
  end
end
commit_list.repo_description: Ruby toolkit for the GitHub API

commit_list.message:
extra dot-dsl tests

These extra 2 tests helped me implement the solution more
incrementally and I thought it would help others too.

remove leading slashes in paths for enterprise use

Main fix is in Request#request -- just strips the leading slash.
I also removed the leading slashes in existing calls.
I had considered doing this in spec/helper.rb, but couldn't get a
good error message.
module Octokit::Request
  alias :request_without_assert :request
  def request(method, path, options, version, authenticate, raw, force_urlencoded)
    path.start_with?('/').should == false #will fail in github:enterprise
    request_without_assert(method, path, options, version, authenticate, raw, force_urlencoded)
  end
end

more conservative Struct#to_hash

As the modified test shows, a list<string> would not work because
String#to_hash doesn't exist. Solution: don't call String#to_hash
to_hash recursive for individual embedded thrift structs

supply first and last name in addresses

The fields are optional for Braintree credit cards, but PayPal requires
them or else the whole shipping address is stripped. The shipping
address needs to arrive in PayPal to provide seller protection.

remove leading slashes in paths for enterprise use

Main fix is in Request#request -- just strips the leading slash.
I also removed the leading slashes in existing calls.
I had considered doing this in spec/helper.rb, but couldn't get a
good error message.
module Octokit::Request
  alias :request_without_assert :request
  def request(method, path, options, version, authenticate, raw, force_urlencoded)
    path.start_with?('/').should == false #will fail in github:enterprise
    request_without_assert(method, path, options, version, authenticate, raw, force_urlencoded)
  end
end

fix for issue #1896

If the enumerable is an even multiple of the counter (n) and an explicit
pad is given, you get an extra element.

Enum.chunks([1,2,3], 3)
iex> [[1,2,3]]
as expected, but

Enum.chunks([1,2,3], 3, 3, [""])
iex> [[1,2,3],[""]]
as not expected
commit_list.repo_description: The official elixir ExDocs rendered with my makeup library

commit_list.message:
supply first and last name in addresses

The fields are optional for Braintree credit cards, but PayPal requires
them or else the whole shipping address is stripped. The shipping
address needs to arrive in PayPal to provide seller protection.

refactor #determine_order_user helper method

There's no behavior change to this. It allows subclasses
to easily override how to determine the user.
no need for merge_one any more

improve assigning addresses to unsaved user

This was originally noticed in tests that wanted to create a user
with a ship_address at once. I don't know how common it might happen
in production, but seems a reasonable expectation. The core issue
was the reset at the end of mark_default -- the unsaved UserAddress
was getting dropped. That reset was originally put in place to ensure
ordering of the default address first and to let us re-add a previously
removed address. So additional tests were added and a new approach
found.

new AddressBookController

provides endpoints suitable for a custom address book management UI
adds a Spree:Config preference: automatic_default_address
more use of scopes in UserAddress
UserAddressBook makes ship_address more clearly secondary in favor of
default_address
test coverage

fix for user_address association caching corner case

improves User and Address factories
now with less reload

Implementing a user's address book functionality

Consists of:
* a UserAddressBook module for inclusion into User model
* a UserAddress join model to include default flag
* making Address readonly with copy-on-write behavior
* removing defensive cloning of Address
* improving Address clone/default/copy behavior
* backwards compatibility with existing Order address behavior, but adding a User reference to the address
* backwards compatability for frontend, backend behavior relying on accepts_nested_attributes_for
* a rake task/migration to backfill data into new model
* bill_address sticks around with minor use in code, plus it gets added to address book
* SearchController updates to handle addresses association

This is setup work to allow us to surface new behavior in My Account and
Checkout, but as it, you should not see anything new. That also means it
should not break anything.
further refinements to behavior of unexchanged state

Customer can return an item that was previously unexchanged

This fixes the StateMachine::InvalidTransition bug about calling
:receive from :unexchanged state

This represents a case when the customer asked for an exchange, and
ultimately ended up returning both the exchange and the original.
Perhaps even in the same box, but we processed the exchange item first.
It results in the creation of a new ReturnItem for the inventory unit

ReturnItems have a new unexchagned status

It represents when a customer asked for an exchange, but ultimately
kept the original item.

Conflicts:
	core/app/models/spree/return_item.rb
	core/spec/models/spree/return_item_spec.rb
	core/spec/spec_helper.rb

extra dot-dsl tests

These extra 2 tests helped me implement the solution more
incrementally and I thought it would help others too.

extra dot-dsl tests

These extra 2 tests helped me implement the solution more
incrementally and I thought it would help others too.

looks up both public and private channels (groups) (#106)

You can now Lookups.lookup_channel_id for a private channel
and receive a "Gxxx" group identifier
and Lookups.lookup_channel_name for a private channel and
receive the name

configurable display means not stopped app in test_helper
use config hash param to start, but should use config.exs
'mix test' works because we stop the app in test_helper
test for timeout tick behavior of Car
parametrize Car in prep for test case
parking is now a clause of velocity
rename update_velocity to move and create helper velocity function
add retrieve_call to timeout pipeline always
can respond to call, but not a go_to yet
lose the should_stop? function plus commentary
simplify now that I understand struct pattern matching
remove update_heading in favor of Elevator.Call.dir
extract Elevator.Call to own file, plus simplifying refactoring
use heading instead of dir for Car
it's immutable, no need to copy defensively
update to use new genserver modules
store full Call in Car state
arrive and stop at a destination floor
quit things in the right order
minor cleanup in integration test simulator
no need to stop and start thread in HUP

beef up handling of twitter rate limiting
integration test added, plus minor tweaks

HUP working by making TagCache#reset unsynchronized
minor TODO cleanup, but HUP not working
top level run script instead of within tweet_top_ten.rb
rescue blocks added and connection retry in case of temp network outage
refactoring toward properly closing http connection
ok, let's shorten this threading test
improved assertion for threaded TagCache test
avoid nested synchronize blocks for tidiness
use module_function instead of self. in TwitterTagTracker
first impl of TagCache and top10
tight impl written post code retreat
flatten namespace and move RULES into Type
minor fix to use lazy instance var and to_s
major tightening and beefing up of tests
refactoring around type and method names
rename stats to fcards. add fsuits
new power_cards method. Lose strength method
pull out desc_face_value singleton method. Not sure though. I may go back to it
hand characteristics realized as important concept. Centralize logic there
refactor strength method plus interator on statsk
strength is no longer an array of two element arrays. Just the rank first, then the sorted face values
minor refactoring of names and using 1.9's Proc.to_symbol (&:method)
removed Card class in favor of aliases in Array
no need for single strength number. Compare arrays again
new euler54.rb shows 376 wins by player 1
more misc minor cleanups. Now StrengthDigit doesn't have much to do
FrequencyStats gone. Functionality now in two singleton methods of frequency Hash
get rid of freq_count method. Now FrequencyStats doesn't hold its weight
refactor max_freq into a singleton method
move is_flush and is_straight into Hand
another minor refactoring of the implied all?

passing full house beats 3 of a kind test
passing max strength of full house test
failing test for max strength of full house
strength method now supplies max_frequency instead of a lower end offset
refactor to strength_digits method using the face values in descending frequency, instead of ascending
all green. old tests comparing two hands now exercises new code
putting a strength method on FrequencyStats
broken test for two small pairs vs. one big pair
minor change to clean up duplication noted today
refactoring to introduce FrequencyStats helper class. Too lazy to separate files
refactoring to introduce a StrengthDigit helper class
a new approach in calculating hand strength passes the last test. I've been trying to do this two times and had to give up. 3rd time was a charm
failing test using kicker to resolve tied pairs
fix spec that supplies 10 instead of T
tried to refactor, but it broke a test, so checking in working code with better diagnose-ability
here's some other specs for free. Couldn't decide on which type of next test to write: resolve paris with kickers, or full-house, or flush, or straight
OK, I couldn't resist, implemented a rudimentary frequency map
failing test for pair beating nothing
minor refactor to use dual ints instead of ranges for substrings
refactor the ugly get_face (which was really setting) into a default proc of the hash. Not completely satisfied, but I do like it better
failing test for Hand. seems like time to add it now
refactored and removed int/string equivalency spec. I don't know what that string.take method was, but I don't think it was doing what you thought it was doing
undo something that broke autospec. back to subdirs
get rid of spec subdir since new .autotest file takes care of it
modify require to use relative path

commit_list.message:
refactor #determine_order_user helper method

There's no behavior change to this. It allows subclasses
to easily override how to determine the user.
no need for merge_one any more

improve assigning addresses to unsaved user

This was originally noticed in tests that wanted to create a user
with a ship_address at once. I don't know how common it might happen
in production, but seems a reasonable expectation. The core issue
was the reset at the end of mark_default -- the unsaved UserAddress
was getting dropped. That reset was originally put in place to ensure
ordering of the default address first and to let us re-add a previously
removed address. So additional tests were added and a new approach
found.

new AddressBookController

provides endpoints suitable for a custom address book management UI
adds a Spree:Config preference: automatic_default_address
more use of scopes in UserAddress
UserAddressBook makes ship_address more clearly secondary in favor of
default_address
test coverage

fix for user_address association caching corner case

improves User and Address factories
now with less reload

Implementing a user's address book functionality

Consists of:
* a UserAddressBook module for inclusion into User model
* a UserAddress join model to include default flag
* making Address readonly with copy-on-write behavior
* removing defensive cloning of Address
* improving Address clone/default/copy behavior
* backwards compatibility with existing Order address behavior, but adding a User reference to the address
* backwards compatability for frontend, backend behavior relying on accepts_nested_attributes_for
* a rake task/migration to backfill data into new model
* bill_address sticks around with minor use in code, plus it gets added to address book
* SearchController updates to handle addresses association

This is setup work to allow us to surface new behavior in My Account and
Checkout, but as it, you should not see anything new. That also means it
should not break anything.
further refinements to behavior of unexchanged state

Customer can return an item that was previously unexchanged

This fixes the StateMachine::InvalidTransition bug about calling
:receive from :unexchanged state

This represents a case when the customer asked for an exchange, and
ultimately ended up returning both the exchange and the original.
Perhaps even in the same box, but we processed the exchange item first.
It results in the creation of a new ReturnItem for the inventory unit

ReturnItems have a new unexchagned status

It represents when a customer asked for an exchange, but ultimately
kept the original item.

Conflicts:
	core/app/models/spree/return_item.rb
	core/spec/models/spree/return_item_spec.rb
	core/spec/spec_helper.rb
